line-7: 🌟 Join Our Team at Network Rail! 🌟  Are you ready to make a difference in people's lives? At Network Rail, we connect passengers and freight customers, ensuring safe and efficient transportation across the country. We're an organisation where people truly matter, and when you join us, you matter to us and millions of others. Click here to watch our inspiring video to learn more about us!  We're dedicated to building a diverse and inclusive organisation that reflects the passengers we serve. If you're passionate about making a meaningful impact, then this opportunity is for you!

line-11: A typical day  Day to day, you will take guidance from the Senior Programme Manager and direct your team to ensure they are progressing in line with the strategic direction of the portfolio. Each day will provide new achievements and challenges, but what ties them all together is the responsibility to drive the delivery of the portfolio, lead a team in a hybrid working environment, and report on benefits and outcomes.  A typical day could involve delivering of a presentation at a periodic industry meeting to update on the latest portfolio progress and to gain support for a particular initiative you are leading that requires leadership buy in.  This could be followed by a meeting with a key stakeholder providing feedback on their experience using the tool we recently implemented. You could be copied into a communication that requires your review and approval to ensure the key messaging aligns with portfolio objectives and wider department context.  After lunch you might have a 1:1 with one of your direct reports as they update you on their priorities for the week. Then you might spend time preparing key updates to pass on to the Senior Programme Manager for a meeting they have with Regional Directors the following day to build their support for the next big milestone.     Essential skills and experience required  �       Strong Interpersonal Skills: Demonstrate excellent interpersonal, management, and communication skills to effectively lead and collaborate with teams  �       Proven Programme Management Experience: Bring substantial, documented experience in programme management, illustrating your ability to drive successful program outcomes.  �       Proficiency in Control Processes: Exhibit a deep understanding of programme and project controls processes and systems, ensuring efficient and effective management.  �       Team Development: Show a track record of managing and developing teams to achieve high performance, highlighting your leadership capabilities.  �       Stakeholder Engagement: Demonstrate your proven ability to work closely with senior industry stakeholders, understanding their requirements and fostering productive relationships.     Nice to have  �       Professional Accreditation: Further personal or industry qualifications such as project management, change management, railway operations.     If you meet these essential criteria, we invite you to apply and be a part of our team, contributing to the success of our dynamic portfolio.
